wikipedia_page.main: Ernest Hall (6 August 1916 – 7 July 1944) was a footballer who played in the Football League for Brighton & Hove Albion and Newcastle United.

link_mentions.page: List of footballers killed during World War II
response: * Ernest Hall – played for Newcastle United (1935–1936) and Brighton & Hove Albion (1937–1938). A pilot officer in the RAFVR, he was killed serving as a Vickers Wellington bomber pilot in raid on St Polten, Austria, on 7 July 1944 aged 27.
* Ernest Hall (businessman) (born 1930), English businessman and pianist
* Ernest Hall (footballer) (1916–1944), footballer for Brighton & Hove Albion, Newcastle United and Stoke City
* Ernest Hall (politician) (1929–1987), English-born merchant and political figure in British Columbia
